jurisdictions.name: City of Chicago
jurisdictions.notes: Express Permit Program (EPP) offers same-day approval at $275 flat fee. Requires licensed electrical contractor and ICC DG Installer certification. ComEd interconnection. IL Shines SREC program. Landmarks/historic district review may apply.

jurisdictions.name: City of Aurora
jurisdictions.notes: Standard IL permitting. ComEd interconnection. IL Adjustable Block Program incentives available.

jurisdictions.name: City of Naperville
jurisdictions.notes: SolSmart designated community. ComEd interconnection. Naperville has own electric utility for some areas.

jurisdictions.name: City of Rockford
jurisdictions.notes: Standard IL permitting. ComEd interconnection. Northern IL snow loads 25-30 psf.

jurisdictions.name: City of Springfield
jurisdictions.notes: Standard IL permitting. CWLP (City Water Light & Power) municipal utility provides interconnection. Ameren Illinois may serve surrounding areas.

state_level_requirements.contractor_license_type: No dedicated state solar license. Licensed electrical contractor required for PV work. ICC Distributed Generation (DG) Installer certification required in Chicago. Chicago has specific licensing requirements.
state_level_requirements.net_metering_details: Net metering for systems up to 2 MW. As of January 1, 2025, Illinois transitioned to supply-only net metering for new installations (credits for supply portion only, not delivery charges). ComEd and Ameren Illinois are major utilities. Monthly rollover.
state_level_requirements.solar_access_details: Homeowners' Energy Policy Statement Act (2021): HOAs cannot prohibit solar installations. May impose only reasonable restrictions that do not significantly increase cost or decrease efficiency.
state_level_requirements.solarapp_details: Illinois Solar Energy Association promotes SolarAPP+ adoption. No statewide mandate. Chicago Express Permit Program provides same-day permitting alternative.
state_level_requirements.state_incentive_program: Adjustable Block Program (IL Shines) under CEJA provides substantial SREC incentives; Illinois Solar for All (low-income); property and sales tax exemptions; supply-only net metering (post-2025); Community Solar program
